The function relies on external metrics and helper functions to compute these values.

It filters the DataFrame to include only those rows where the value in the 'Einigung_Netto' column is between 0.01 and 1, inclusive. The function then calculates the count of such rows and returns both the filtered DataFrame and the count as a tuple.

parameters.description: DataFrame that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: proforma
returns.description: DataFrame containing all found pro forma receipt rows

returns.description: Amount of found receipts

description.overall: The function 'position_count' takes a pandas DataFrame as input and groups the data by the column 'KvaRechnung_ID'. For each unique 'KvaRechnung_ID', it counts the number of associated 'Position_ID' entries. The result is a new DataFrame containing two columns: 'KvaRechnung_ID' and 'PositionsAnzahl', which represents the count of positions for each ID. This operation is commonly used for aggregating transactional or record-based data to summarize counts per identifier.

parameters.name: input_df
parameters.description: DataFrame that is to be evaluated.

description.overall: This function evaluates a DataFrame containing 'Auftragsdaten' data to identify inconsistencies in the Tuple (Forderung, Empfehlung, Einigung). It checks whether, when at least two values in these three columns are negative, the third value is also negative. Any violations of this rule are counted and returned as an error count. The function uses boolean masking to determine which rows fail the condition.

parameters.description: DataFrame with 'Auftragsdaten' data set that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: error_count
returns.description: Number of entries in any of the three columns Forderung, Empfehlung or Einigung failing the check.

description.overall: The function 'false_negative_df2' evaluates a 'Positionsdaten' dataset contained in a pandas DataFrame for entries in specific columns that fall outside of reasonable value ranges. It checks for negative values in columns such as 'Menge', 'Menge_Einigung', 'EP', 'Ep_Einigung', 'Forderung_Netto', and 'Einigung_Netto'. The function aggregates the count of invalid entries across these columns and returns a total error count. This is useful for identifying potential data quality issues in financial or inventory datasets.

description.overall: This function identifies outliers in a specified numerical column of a pandas DataFrame based on a given quantile range, considering different damage types. It calculates symmetric upper and lower bounds for each group of damage types and filters the DataFrame to return only rows that fall outside these bounds. The function supports filtering by a specific damage type and allows customization of the quantile range and column name.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: DataFrame to be evaluated

parameters.name: schadenart
parameters.description: specific damage type label to filter for, by default None

parameters.name: set_quantile
parameters.description: desired quantile range, symmetric upper/lower bound is inferred, by default 0.99

parameters.name: column_choice
parameters.description: numeric column containing outliers, by default 'Forderung_Netto'

returns.name: df_outlier
returns.description: df containing all suspicious rows

description.overall: The function 'check_zeitwert' evaluates whether the values in the column 'Differenz_vor_Zeitwert_Netto' satisfy a specific condition related to 'Zeitwert = Forderung-Einigung'. It computes the relative error by comparing the difference between 'Forderung_Netto' and 'Einigung_Netto' with the 'Differenz_vor_Zeitwert_Netto'. This function is intended for use with 'Auftragsdaten' datasets. The result is a pandas Series containing only the non-zero error values.

description.overall: This function calculates the average number of positions per order for each month based on two input DataFrames. It first counts the number of positions associated with each order ID in the second DataFrame, then merges this information with the first DataFrame to associate orders with their respective position counts. The function aggregates these counts by month to compute averages, totals, and counts of orders per period. Finally, it computes the percentage growth rate of the average positions per order over time.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Auftragsdaten mit Spalte 'KvaRechnung_ID' und einer Zeitspalte.

parameters.name: df2
parameters.description: Positionsdaten mit Spalten 'KvaRechnung_ID' und 'Position_ID'.

parameters.name: time_col
parameters.description: Name der Zeitspalte in orders_df (z.B. 'CRMEingangszeit').

returns.name: result
returns.description: DataFrame mit Spalten: 'Zeitperiode', 'Avg_Positionen_pro_Auftrag', 'Total_Positionen', 'Anzahl_Auftraege', 'Growth_rate_%'

description.overall: Die Funktion aggregiert die Fehlerhäufigkeit (NaN-Werte) in einem DataFrame nach Wochentag und Stunde. Ein Auftrag gilt als fehlerhaft, wenn in mindestens einer der relevanten Spalten ein NaN-Wert vorkommt. Sie wandelt die Zeitspalte in ein Datetime-Format um, extrahiert Wochentag und Stunde, bestimmt relevante Spalten zur Prüfung auf NaN und berechnet dann die Fehlerquote pro Zeitfenster. Das Ergebnis ist ein DataFrame mit den Spalten 'weekday', 'hour', 'total_rows', 'error_rows' und 'error_rate'.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Auftragsdaten-DataFrame (z.B. Auftragsdaten_konvertiert), muss 'KvaRechnung_ID' und die Zeitspalte enthalten.

parameters.name: time_col
parameters.description: Name der Zeitspalte in df, z.B. 'CRMEingangszeit'.

parameters.name: relevant_columns
parameters.description: Liste der Spalten, die auf NaN geprüft werden sollen. Wenn None -> alle Spalten außer 'KvaRechnung_ID' und time_col.

returns.name: result
returns.description: DataFrame mit Spalten: 'weekday' (Name des Wochentags), 'hour' (Stunde von 0 bis 23), 'total_rows' (Anzahl Aufträge in diesem Zeit-Slot), 'error_rows' (Anzahl fehlerhafter Aufträge in diesem Slot), 'error_rate' (Fehlerquote in Prozent).

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: The function 'get_mismatched_entries' computes similarity scores between pairs of 'Gewerk_Name' and 'Handwerker_Name' entries in a DataFrame using sentence embeddings. It leverages a pre-trained multilingual model to encode the text and calculates cosine distances to determine similarity. Entries with similarity scores below a given threshold are identified as mismatches and returned sorted by similarity score.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: A pandas DataFrame containing columns 'Gewerk_Name' and 'Handwerker_Name' to compare.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: A float value representing the minimum similarity score required to consider an entry pair as a match. Default is 0.2.

returns.name: mismatches
returns.description: A copy of the input DataFrame filtered to include only rows where the similarity score is less than the specified threshold, sorted in ascending order of similarity score.

description.overall: This function processes a DataFrame to identify outliers in the relationship between craftsmen and their trades. It calculates the ratio of each trade per craftsman and flags those trades as outliers if the craftsman has more than one trade and the trade represents less than 20% of their total trades. The function filters out missing values and returns a DataFrame with the results.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Input DataFrame containing columns 'Handwerker_Name' and 'Gewerk_Name'.

returns.name: stats
returns.description: A DataFrame containing information about craftsmen, their trades, counts, ratios, and outlier status.

description.overall: This function analyzes a DataFrame to determine if the 'Handwerker_Name' column contains keywords associated with specific trades ('Gewerk_Name'). It uses a predefined mapping of keywords for each trade to identify potential matches. If a keyword is found in the name and corresponds to the expected trade, it marks the entry as 'CONFIRMED_BY_NAME'. If a keyword is present but does not match the trade, it flags a conflict. Otherwise, it returns 'NO_KEYWORD_INFO'.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: A pandas DataFrame containing at least two columns: 'Handwerker_Name' and 'Gewerk_Name'.

returns.name: final_result
returns.description: An array or Series of strings indicating whether the entry was confirmed by name, flagged for conflict, or had no keyword information.

usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: Die Funktion 'abgleich_auftraege' vergleicht die Kopfdaten von Aufträgen (df1) mit der Summe ihrer Positionen (df2). Sie gruppiert die Positionsdaten nach 'Kva_RechnungID', bildet die Summen für 'Forderung_Netto' und 'Einigung_Netto', und vergleicht diese mit den Werten in df1. Die Funktion berücksichtigt Gleitkommagenauigkeitsunterschiede durch den Einsatz von np.isclose. Die Ergebnisse werden als DataFrame zurückgegeben, das nur die IDs mit Abweichungen enthält.

parameters.name: df1
parameters.description: Dataframe mit den Auftragsdaten (Soll-Werte). Muss folgende Spalten enthalten: 'Kva_RechnungID', 'Forderung_Netto', 'Einigung_Netto'.

parameters.name: df2
parameters.description: Dataframe mit den Positionsdaten (Ist-Werte). Muss folgende Spalten enthalten: 'Kva_RechnungID', 'Forderung_Netto', 'Einigung_Netto'.

returns.name: result_df
returns.description: Eine Liste der Abweichungen. Der Dataframe enthält nur die IDs, bei denen die Werte nicht übereinstimmen. Enthaltene Spalten: 'KvaRechnung_ID', 'Diff_Forderung', 'Diff_Einigung'.
